column4: Can anyone say for sure if the major integration of pulseaudio in 9.10 is due to development changes in the Gnome project or if this was a decision made by Ubuntu devs? Cause I have seen fedora 12 with gnome and it seems to be lacking the volume panel applet as well when pulseaudio is removed from the system. So Im assuming this has been a Gnome change and therefore its a cross distro change for better or worse.
Yes I know the workaround but Im wondering if it was a decision by Gnome or Ubuntu devs.
BTW who would I need to run alsamixer with sudo? It runs fine without it. Is there a reason Im not aware of?
